docs.text: the tagline for this film is : " some houses are just born bad " .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: so i didn't expect too much from this .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but i had preserved a little spark of ope as i entered the theatre .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i thought : liam neeson , cathrine zeta jones and jan de bont .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i thought , mabe it will be fun ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and in fact the beginning was rather intriguing .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but by the end of it i thought : why liam neeson and cathrine zeta jones , jan de bont ? .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: these great actors are basically helpless with this muddled mess that defies any rationality .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: here is the story : in the monstrously over-decorated mansion known as hill house , visitors are tricked by an unknown doctor ( liam neeson ) into being guinea pigs in a fright experiment under the guise of an insomnia investigation .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: among them is a sophisticated bisexual ( cathrine zeta jones ) , a cynical dope ( owen wilson ) and a gentle and emotional lady ( lily taylor ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: actually , the doctor is researching the " primordial fear reaction " and intends to plant disturbing ideas in his subjects and watch what happens .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but he gets unexpected help from the house itself .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it rumbles , hums and belches forth remarkable sights .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: portals become veiny stained-glass eyeballs .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a fireplace guarded by stone lions gapes like a sinister mouth .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: filmy cherubic spirits take shape under sheets and billowy curtains .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but the computerized spooketeria rarely feels real , placing an emotional wall between audience and screen .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the second half of the film is basically about the main heroine running back and forth from the sinister lamps and evil furniture .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: is that exciting or what ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the worst thing about it is that it didn't have to be bad .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's based on a great book , ``the haunting of hill house , '' by shirley jackson .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a 1963 adaptation of the book was scary and intelligent .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it played with the greatest fears of our sub conscience .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " the blair witch project " , that cost less than an old car , managed to shock and terrify the audiences from their senses .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and with a $70 mill .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: budget , de bont and screenwriter david self make hash out of a perfectly lovely piece of terror .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: de bont has a style of filmmaking so out of line with the material that it is , in itself , frightening .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he is the master of the extravagant special effect and the big visual adrenaline rush .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but why give him a more serious material ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in the end " haunting " will only haunt its fledgling studio ( dream works skg ) and de bont's career as a director .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: yet it wouldn't be fair to say that everything is bad .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the effects are truly impressive and the house is wonderfully decorated -- beautiful , mysterious , magical and spooky .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but this is where the good things end .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the music is blaring , the floors moving , the ceiling morphing and the pictures on the walls screaming -- and all of this , every second , every moment of screen time , is absolutely without life .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's nothing more than a special effects-extravaganza ; visually impressive , but intellectually hollow thriller that simply doesn't engage .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: at first you do not know what's going on .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: is this part of the experiment ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: are these hallucinations ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: projections of the subconscience ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: paranoia ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but in the end it shows out that this is actually happening .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the house is actually possessed .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it is at that point when all your hopes for a good entertainment disappears out of the window .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: for ever , i sat in anticipation for a decent climax and that's what i got ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i believe hichock once said that " it's better to wait for a climax , than to see one " .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this may be true , and it might actually work , but there is only one problem -- jan de bont is not hichock and the things that he shows are not scary , only stupid .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: they are impossible to take seriously .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: any paralells that you might have heard before , linking this picture to kubrick's " the shining " , are absolutely baseless .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " shining " had class , style , story , acting , but most of all talent and originality .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " haunting " has only special effects and art direction to boast of .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and those elements alone are not enough to make it a good film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: casting good actors for small , pale parts only makes things worse .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but i guess that no matter what i or other critics say or write , most of you will see this film anyway , even if the tagline would say : " some films are just born stupid " .
docs.label: negative
